intro: Quercus menadoensis, commonly known as the Menado oak, is a species of flowering plant in the beech family, Fagaceae. It is native to the Indonesian island of Halmahera and is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves and acorn-like fruits. The plant typically grows in lowland rainforests and is often found in secondary forest regrowth areas. It plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
